name: Araku Valley Arabica Coffee
description: Araku Valley Arabica Coffee, grown around Visakhapatnam district in Andhra Pradesh and Koraput district in Odisha, is light to medium in strength, has a pleasant acidity with a citrus note of grape fruit and a mild jaggery-like sweetness.

name: Banaganapalle Mangoes
description: Banaganapalle Mangoes are a premium variety of mangoes grown in the Banaganapalle region of Andhra Pradesh. Known for their oblong shape, bright yellow color, smooth skin, and sweet taste, they are among the most popular table mangoes in India.

name: Guntur Sannam Chilli
description: Guntur Sannam Chilli, grown in the Guntur district of Andhra Pradesh, is known for its vibrant red color, pungency, and high capsaicin content. Widely used in Indian cuisine, it is a key ingredient for adding spice and flavor.

name: Arunachal Orange
description: Arunachal Orange, cultivated in the tropical valleys and foothills of Arunachal Pradesh, is known for its bright orange color, high juice content, and balanced sweetness with a tangy flavor. It has received GI tag status for its unique regional characteristics.

name: Assam Orthodox Tea
description: Assam Orthodox Tea is a premium variety of tea produced from the Camellia sinensis plant in Assam. Known for its malty flavor, bright liquor, and rich aroma, it is carefully handpicked and processed using traditional methods, giving it GI tag status.

name: Assam Karbi Anglong Ginger
description: Assam Karbi Anglong Ginger is a GI-tagged spice known for its rich aroma, high dry matter content, and minimal fiber. Grown organically in the Karbi Anglong district of Assam, it is highly valued in culinary and medicinal uses.

name: Boka Chaul
description: Boka Chaul is a traditional GI-tagged rice variety from Assam, known for its soft texture and ease of consumption without cooking. This semi-glutinous rice is soaked and eaten directly with milk or curd, offering a quick, nutritious meal.

name: Chokuwa Rice
description: Chokuwa Rice is a GI-tagged semi-glutinous rice variety from Assam known for its ability to cook quickly with minimal soaking. Traditionally consumed as soaked or lightly boiled rice, it is prized for its digestibility, softness, and cultural importance among Assamese communities.

name: Joha Rice
description: Joha Rice is a fragrant, short-grained, GI-tagged rice variety from Assam. Celebrated for its unique aroma, delicate texture, and slightly sweet taste, it is traditionally used in Assamese sweets, festive dishes, and everyday meals.

name: Kaji Nemu (Assam Lemon)
description: Kaji Nemu, also known as Assam Lemon, is a GI-tagged citrus fruit from Assam known for its elongated shape, thin skin, and high juice content. Its refreshing aroma and low acidity make it a staple in Assamese cuisine, especially in salads, curries, and beverages.

name: Tezpur Litchi
description: Tezpur Litchi is a GI-tagged fruit from Assam, known for its excellent quality, distinct flavor, and juicy pulp. Grown in the Tezpur region, this litchi variety is appreciated for its attractive rose-red skin and sweet aroma, making it a seasonal delicacy in Assam and beyond.

name: Bhagalpuri Zardalu Mango
description: Bhagalpuri Zardalu is a GI-tagged early to mid-season variety of mango from Bhagalpur and adjoining regions of Banka and Munger districts in Bihar. Known for its sweet, aromatic flavor and golden-yellow skin, it is one of the most sought-after mango varieties in the region.

name: Katarni Rice
description: Katarni Rice is a GI-tagged fine grain scented landrace variety from Bihar. Known for its unique aroma, slender grains, and excellent cooking quality, it is prized for traditional dishes and festive occasions.

name: Magahi Paan
description: Magahi Paan is a traditional GI-tagged betel leaf variety from Bihar, renowned for its large size, glossy texture, and unique aroma. Widely used in cultural rituals and local cuisine, it holds special significance in the Magadh region.

name: Shahi Litchi
description: Shahi Litchi is a premium GI-tagged variety of litchi from Bihar, known for its large size, juicy pulp, and distinctive sweet flavor. Grown primarily in Muzaffarpur and adjoining regions, it is celebrated as the 'King of Litchis' in India.

name: Jeeraphool Rice
description: Jeeraphool Rice is a GI-tagged aromatic fine-grain rice variety from Chhattisgarh, prized for its unique fragrance, slender grains, and excellent cooking qualities. This traditional landrace rice is an important part of Chhattisgarh's rich agricultural heritage.

name: Basmati Rice
description: Basmati Rice is a premium long-grain aromatic rice variety known for its distinctive fragrance, fluffy texture, and excellent cooking quality. This variety is popular across India and is prized for special dishes like biryani and pulao.

name: Khola Chilli
description: Khola Chilli is a GI-tagged traditional chilli variety from Goa, known for its distinct aroma, moderate heat, and culinary versatility. It is widely used in Goan cuisine for adding flavor and spice.

name: Bhalia Wheat
description: Bhalia Wheat is a GI-tagged wheat variety from the Bhal region of Gujarat, known for its high gluten content and excellent baking qualities. It is widely used in traditional Indian breads and bakery products.

name: Gir Kesar Mango
description: Gir Kesar Mango is a GI-tagged mango variety from the Gir region of Gujarat, famous for its bright orange pulp, sweet taste, and unique aroma. It is prized for its rich flavor and smooth texture.

name: Basmati Rice
description: Basmati Rice from Haryana is a premium GI-tagged aromatic long-grain rice, known for its distinct fragrance, fluffy texture, and excellent cooking qualities. Widely used in Indian cuisine, especially for biryanis and pulaos.

name: Basmati Rice
description: Basmati Rice from Himachal Pradesh is a premium GI-tagged aromatic long-grain rice, known for its distinctive fragrance, fluffy texture, and excellent cooking qualities. It is a favored choice for special Indian dishes like biryani and pulao.

name: Himachali Kala Zeera
description: Himachali Kala Zeera is a rare GI-tagged black cumin spice from Himachal Pradesh, prized for its distinctive aroma, mild bitterness, and culinary uses in traditional Himachali and Indian dishes.

name: Kangra Tea
description: Kangra Tea is a distinguished GI-tagged variety cultivated in the Kangra Valley of Himachal Pradesh. Known for its subtle flavor, low astringency, and distinctive floral aroma, Kangra Tea has been prized since colonial times for its light liquor and muscatel notes. Both green and black variants are produced, with minimal oxidation imparting it a unique character unmatched in other Indian teas.

name: Kashmir Saffron
description: Kashmir Saffron is a highly prized GI-tagged spice grown in the Pampore region of Jammu & Kashmir. Known for its deep red color, strong aroma, and high crocin content, it is among the world's finest saffron varieties, used extensively in culinary, medicinal, and cosmetic applications.

name: Basmati Rice
description: Basmati Rice from Jammu & Kashmir is a GI-tagged premium long-grain rice, known for its exceptional aroma, slender grains, and fluffy texture. Cultivated in the Himalayan foothills, it is cherished for traditional dishes like pulao and biryani.

name: Coorg Arabica Coffee
description: Coorg Arabica Coffee is a GI-tagged premium coffee grown in the Kodagu district of Karnataka. It is known for its mild flavor, fine aroma, and balanced acidity, cultivated under the shade of evergreen forests, often intercropped with spices like pepper and cardamom.

name: Malabar Pepper
description: Malabar Pepper is a GI-tagged spice from the Western Ghats region of Karnataka and Kerala, known for its bold, pungent flavor and rich aroma. Cultivated in the humid tropics of the Malabar coast, it is widely regarded as one of the finest black pepper varieties in the world.

name: Appemidi Mango
description: Appemidi Mango is a GI-tagged traditional pickle variety mango native to the Western Ghats of Karnataka. Known for its intense aroma, small size, and thick skin, it is prized for making long-lasting pickles without the need for added preservatives.

name: Bababudangiris Arabica Coffee
description: Bababudangiris Arabica Coffee is a GI-tagged specialty coffee grown in the Baba Budan Giri hills of Chikmagalur, Karnataka. Revered as the birthplace of Indian coffee, it offers a rich aroma, medium body, and mild acidity, making it one of the most premium Arabica varieties in India.

name: Bangalore Blue Grapes
description: Bangalore Blue Grapes are GI-tagged, uniquely flavored grapes grown in and around Bangalore, Karnataka. Known for their deep blue color, foxy flavor, and thick skin, these grapes are ideal for eating fresh, juicing, and making wines and jams.

name: Bangalore Rose Onion
description: Bangalore Rose Onion is a GI-tagged onion variety from Karnataka, known for its deep pink to dark red color, high pungency, and longer shelf life. Cultivated in and around Bangalore, it is widely used in pickling, seasoning, and South Indian cuisine.

name: Byadagi Chilli
description: Byadagi Chilli is a GI-tagged variety of chilli mainly grown in Karnataka. Known for its deep red color, mild pungency, and high oil content, it is widely used in Indian cuisine, especially in spice blends and traditional South Indian dishes.

name: Chikmagalur Arabica Coffee
description: Chikmagalur Arabica Coffee is a GI-tagged premium coffee grown in the lush hills of Chikmagalur district, Karnataka. Known as the birthplace of Indian coffee, it is celebrated for its mild flavor, fine aroma, and smooth body, making it a favorite among coffee connoisseurs.

name: Coorg Green Cardamom
description: Coorg Green Cardamom is a GI-tagged spice cultivated in the cool, misty hills of Coorg, Karnataka. It is known for its intense aroma, bold green pods, and high oil content, making it a prized ingredient in Indian sweets, chai, and traditional spice blends.

name: Coorg Orange
description: Coorg Orange is a GI-tagged citrus fruit cultivated in the hilly terrains of Kodagu (Coorg) in Karnataka. Known for its bright orange color, juicy pulp, and distinct sweet-tangy flavor, it is traditionally grown alongside coffee plantations and is a key part of Coorg's agro-heritage.

name: Devanahalli Pomelo
description: Devanahalli Pomelo is a GI-tagged citrus fruit grown in the Devanahalli region near Bengaluru, Karnataka. Known for its large size, thick rind, and sweet, mildly tangy pulp, it is prized for its refreshing taste and minimal bitterness, distinguishing it from other pomelo varieties.

name: Gulbarga Tur Dal
description: Gulbarga Tur Dal, also known as Kalaburagi Red Gram, is a GI-tagged pulse grown in the Kalaburagi region of Karnataka. Renowned for its uniform size, rich golden color, and superior cooking quality, this dal is a staple in Indian kitchens, especially for preparing flavorful dals and curries.

name: Monsooned Malabar Robusta Coffee
description: Monsooned Malabar Robusta Coffee is a GI-tagged specialty coffee from the Malabar coast of Karnataka. Exposed to monsoon winds in a unique aging process, the beans swell and take on a mellow, smooth, and low-acid flavor with earthy undertones. It is highly prized in espresso blends across the globe.

name: Kamalapur Red Banana
description: Kamalapur Red Banana is a GI-tagged banana variety grown in the Kamalapur region of Kalaburagi district, Karnataka. It is known for its reddish-purple skin, creamy texture, and rich, sweet flavor. This nutrient-rich fruit is high in iron and vitamins, making it a healthy and flavorful choice.

name: Mysore Betel Leaf
description: Mysore Betel Leaf is a GI-tagged variety cultivated in the Mysore region of Karnataka. Known for its heart-shaped leaves, distinct aroma, and tender texture, it is widely used in traditional Indian rituals, cuisine, and medicinal practices.

name: Monsooned Malabar Arabica Coffee
description: Monsooned Malabar Arabica Coffee is a GI-tagged specialty coffee from the Malabar region of Karnataka. Through exposure to monsoon winds, the beans undergo a unique aging process, resulting in a smooth, mellow flavor with low acidity and a distinct earthy aroma, favored by coffee connoisseurs worldwide.

name: Nanjanagud Banana
description: Nanjanagud Banana is a GI-tagged variety cultivated in the Nanjanagud region of Karnataka. Known for its distinct aroma, sweet taste, and creamy texture, this banana variety is favored for fresh consumption and traditional recipes.

name: Sirsi Supari
description: Sirsi Supari is a GI-tagged variety of areca nut cultivated in the Sirsi region of Karnataka. Known for its distinct flavor and quality, it is widely used for chewing purposes and in traditional practices.

name: Udupi Mattu Gulla Brinjal
description: Udupi Mattu Gulla Brinjal is a GI-tagged eggplant variety grown in the Mattu village near Udupi, Karnataka. Known for its small, round, greenish-white fruits with distinct taste and aroma, it is used in traditional South Indian dishes.

name: Malabar Pepper
description: Malabar Pepper is a GI-tagged spice cultivated in the Malabar region of Kerala. Renowned for its bold aroma, pungent flavor, and superior quality, it is a prized ingredient in global cuisines and traditional remedies.

name: Alleppey Green Cardamom
description: Alleppey Green Cardamom is a GI-tagged spice from the Alleppey region of Kerala. Known for its superior aroma, flavor, and vibrant green color, it is widely used in culinary and medicinal applications worldwide.

name: Central Travancore Jaggery
description: Central Travancore Jaggery is a GI-tagged traditional sweetener from the Central Travancore region of Kerala. Made by boiling sugarcane juice without refining, it retains natural minerals and a rich flavor, widely used in sweets and cooking.

name: Chengalikodan Nendran Banana
description: Chengalikodan Nendran Banana is a GI-tagged variety from Kerala known for its unique taste and aroma. It is a popular banana variety used in cooking, snacks, and traditional dishes across the region.

name: Kaipad Rice
description: Kaipad Rice is a GI-tagged aromatic rice variety cultivated in the Kaipad wetlands of Kerala. It is known for its unique taste, texture, and natural cultivation method in saline water fields.

name: Marayoor Jaggery (Marayoor Sharkara)
description: Marayoor Jaggery, locally known as Marayoor Sharkara, is a GI-tagged traditional sweetener made from raw sugarcane juice in the Marayoor region of Kerala. It is prized for its distinct taste, rich flavor, and natural purity.

name: Monsooned Malabar Arabica Coffee
description: Monsooned Malabar Arabica Coffee is a GI-tagged coffee from Kerala known for its unique monsooning process, which imparts a mellow flavor with low acidity and a smooth, rich aroma.

name: Monsooned Malabar Robusta Coffee
description: Monsooned Malabar Robusta Coffee is a GI-tagged coffee from Kerala, known for its unique monsooning process that gives the beans a mellow flavor, low acidity, and smooth, rich aroma distinct from typical robusta coffees.

name: Navara Rice
description: Navara Rice is a GI-tagged traditional medicinal rice variety from Kerala, valued for its unique aroma, texture, and health benefits. It is often used in Ayurvedic preparations and special culinary dishes.

name: Palakkadan Matta Rice
description: Palakkadan Matta Rice is a GI-tagged unique red parboiled rice variety grown in Palakkad district, Kerala. It is known for its distinct taste, coarse texture, and high nutritional value.

name: Pokkali Rice
description: Pokkali Rice is a GI-tagged traditional salt-tolerant rice variety cultivated in the coastal regions of Kerala. It is known for its unique ability to grow in saline water and its distinct taste and texture.

name: Tirur Betel Leaf (Tirur Vettila)
description: Tirur Betel Leaf, locally known as Tirur Vettila, is a GI-tagged aromatic betel leaf variety cultivated in Tirur, Kerala. It is prized for its distinctive aroma, tenderness, and glossy appearance, widely used in traditional and cultural practices.

name: Wayanad Gandhakasala Rice
description: Wayanad Gandhakasala Rice is a GI-tagged aromatic rice variety from the Wayanad region of Kerala. Known for its unique fragrance and fine grain, it is traditionally cultivated in the hills of Wayanad.

name: Wayanad Jeerakasala Rice
description: Wayanad Jeerakasala Rice is a GI-tagged traditional aromatic rice variety from the Wayanad region of Kerala, known for its distinct cumin-like aroma and fine grain quality.

name: Nagpur Orange
description: Nagpur Orange is a GI-tagged fruit cultivated in the Nagpur region of Maharashtra. Known for its juicy pulp, bright orange color, and balanced sweetness and acidity, it is one of the finest citrus varieties in India.

name: Mahabaleshwar Strawberry
description: Mahabaleshwar Strawberry is a GI-tagged fruit grown in the cool climate of Mahabaleshwar, Maharashtra. Known for its rich red color, natural sweetness, and juicy texture, it's one of the most popular strawberries in India.

name: Ajara Ghansal Rice
description: Ajara Ghansal Rice is a traditional, aromatic rice variety cultivated in Ajara tehsil of Maharashtra. It is GI-tagged for its fine grain, pleasant aroma, and soft texture after cooking.

name: Alphonso Mango
description: Alphonso Mango, also known as Hapus, is a GI-tagged variety from the Ratnagiri, Sindhudurg, and adjoining regions of Maharashtra. Celebrated for its rich flavor, vibrant saffron-colored pulp, and intense aroma, it is often called the king of mangoes.

name: Ambemohar Rice
description: Ambemohar Rice is a traditional aromatic rice variety grown in the Western Ghats of Maharashtra, particularly in Pune district. Known for its mango blossom fragrance, it is a GI-tagged grain often used in festive Maharashtrian cuisine.

name: Beed Custard Apple
description: Beed Custard Apple, grown in the arid region of Beed district in Maharashtra, is a GI-tagged fruit known for its sweet, creamy pulp and granular texture. It is widely loved for its rich flavor and nutritional value.

name: Nashik Grapes
description: Nashik Grapes are renowned for their sweet and juicy flavor, grown in the fertile vineyards of Nashik, Maharashtra. These GI-tagged grapes are exported globally and enjoyed for their rich taste and nutritional value.

name: Waigaon Turmeric
description: Waigaon Turmeric is known for its high curcumin content and bright yellow color. Cultivated in Waigaon village in Maharashtra, it is valued for medicinal, culinary, and cosmetic uses.

name: Waghya Ghevada
description: Waghya Ghevada is a native legume variety from Maharashtra, valued for its rich protein content and unique flavor. It is commonly used in traditional Maharashtrian dishes.

name: Jalgaon Banana
description: Jalgaon Banana, often referred to as the Banana Capital of India, is known for its size, taste, and long shelf life. Grown in the Jalgaon district of Maharashtra.

name: Kolhapur Jaggery
description: Kolhapur Jaggery is a traditional unrefined sugar with rich iron content and deep golden color, made from sugarcane grown in Kolhapur, Maharashtra. A staple in Indian kitchens.

name: Purandar Fig
description: Purandar Fig is a luscious and nutrient-rich fruit cultivated in the Purandar region of Maharashtra. It has a high demand due to its soft texture and unique taste.

name: Mangalwedha Jowar
description: Mangalwedha Jowar, grown in the dry region of Solapur, is a traditional sorghum variety known for its drought resistance and high nutritional value.

name: Marathwada Kesar Mango
description: Marathwada Kesar Mango is a regional variant of the famous Kesar mango, known for its saffron color and sweetness, cultivated in the Marathwada region of Maharashtra.

name: Sangli Raisins
description: Sangli Raisins are sun-dried grapes from Sangli, Maharashtra. Known for their sweetness, chewy texture, and light golden color, they're ideal for snacking or desserts.

name: Jalna Sweet Orange
description: Jalna Sweet Orange is a juicy, aromatic citrus variety from Jalna, Maharashtra. It is known for its low acidity and natural sweetness.

name: Navapur Tur Dal
description: Navapur Tur Dal from Nandurbar is known for its earthy flavor, uniform grain, and high protein content. A staple in Maharashtrian households.

name: Lasalgaon Onion
description: Lasalgaon Onion, sourced from Asia's largest onion market, is known for its pungency, long shelf life, and reddish-brown skin. A staple in Indian cuisine.

name: Jalgaon Bharit Brinjal
description: Jalgaon Bharit Brinjal is ideal for roasting and making bharit, with a smoky flavor, few seeds, and rich purple skin. Famous in northern Maharashtra.

name: Solapur Pomegranate
description: Solapur Pomegranate is prized for its deep red arils, sweet-tart taste, and excellent shelf life. GI-tagged and exported globally.

name: Bhiwapur Chilli
description: Bhiwapur Chilli from Nagpur is known for its intense red color and pungency. Widely used in masalas and traditional dishes.

name: Dahanu Gholvad Chikoo
description: Dahanu Gholvad Chikoo is famous for its sweetness, grainy texture, and long shelf life. Grown along the Maharashtra coast.

name: Vengurla Cashew
description: Vengurla Cashews are large, sweet, and crunchy nuts from the Konkan region. They have a natural taste and high oil content.

name: Sindhudurg & Ratnagiri Kokum
description: Kokum from Sindhudurg & Ratnagiri is known for its vibrant color and rich sourness. Used in cooling drinks and curries in Konkan cuisine.

name: Chak-Hao (Manipur Black Rice)
description: Chak-Hao is an aromatic, glutinous black rice variety from Manipur, known for its deep purple hue when cooked and rich in antioxidants. Traditionally used in festive dishes like kheer and valued for its health benefits.

name: Kachai Lemon
description: Kachai Lemon, cultivated exclusively in Kachai village of Manipur, is renowned for its high ascorbic acid content and unique tangy flavor. This GI-tagged citrus fruit is used in juices, pickles, and traditional remedies.

name: Khasi Mandarin
description: Khasi Mandarin is a sweet, juicy variety of mandarin orange grown in the hilly regions of Meghalaya. It is known for its bright orange color, loose skin, and unique aroma, making it a prized citrus fruit of the region.

name: Memong Narang
description: Memong Narang is a traditional citrus fruit from Arunachal Pradesh, especially cultivated by the Adi tribe. Known for its distinctive sour taste and high juice content, it is commonly used in local cuisine and medicinal preparations.

name: Mizo Chilli
description: Mizo Chilli, also known locally as Bird's Eye Chilli, is a pungent and flavorful variety grown in Mizoram. It is known for its intense heat, vibrant red color, and is widely used in local cuisines and pickles.

name: Naga Mircha
description: Naga Mircha, also known as Naga King Chilli or Bhut Jolokia, is one of the hottest chillies in the world. Native to Nagaland, this fiery spice is prized for its intense heat and distinctive smoky flavor.

name: Naga Tree Tomato
description: Naga Tree Tomato, also known as tamarillo, is a juicy, tangy fruit grown in the high-altitude regions of Nagaland. Rich in vitamins A, C, and antioxidants, it is used in juices, chutneys, and preserves.

name: Ganjam Kewda Flower
description: Ganjam Kewda Flower, known for its exotic fragrance, is cultivated in Ganjam district of Odisha. It is widely used in the production of perfumes, aromatic products, and kewda water used in culinary traditions.

name: Kandhamal Haladi
description: Kandhamal Haladi is an organic turmeric variety from Kandhamal district of Odisha, known for its high curcumin content, rich aroma, and deep orange-yellow color. It is widely used in cooking and traditional medicine.

name: Punjab Basmati Rice
description: Punjab Basmati Rice is a long-grain aromatic rice cultivated in the fertile plains of Punjab. Known for its distinct fragrance, fluffy texture, and exquisite taste, it is a staple in Indian and international cuisines.

name: Sikkim Large Cardamom
description: Sikkim Large Cardamom, also known as 'Black Cardamom', is a premium spice grown in the Himalayan region of Sikkim. It is known for its bold flavor, intense aroma, and is widely used in traditional Indian cooking and Ayurvedic medicine.

name: Eathomozhy Tall Coconut
description: Eathomozhy Tall Coconut is a traditional tall coconut variety from Tamil Nadu, known for its long lifespan, high yield, and large-sized nuts with high oil content.

name: Erode Manjal (Erode Turmeric)
description: Erode Manjal, or Erode Turmeric, is a GI-tagged spice known for its bright yellow color, high curcumin content, and strong aroma, cultivated in Erode district of Tamil Nadu.

name: Kodaikanal Malai Poondu
description: Kodaikanal Malai Poondu is a mountain garlic variety grown in the hills of Kodaikanal in Tamil Nadu. It is known for its small bulbs, strong flavor, and medicinal properties.

name: Sirumalai Hill Banana
description: Sirumalai Hill Banana is a small, flavorful banana variety grown in the Sirumalai Hills of Tamil Nadu. Known for its natural sweetness and extended shelf life.

name: Virupakshi Hill Banana
description: Virupakshi Hill Banana is an elite banana cultivar from Tamil Nadus Palani hills. It is known for its rich aroma, medicinal value, and long shelf life.

name: Banaganapalle Mangoes
description: Banaganapalle Mangoes are a premium mango variety known for their fiberless flesh, sweet taste, and golden-yellow color. Originating from Telangana, they are widely loved for their rich flavor and long shelf life.

name: Tripura Queen Pineapple
description: Tripura Queen Pineapple is renowned for its pleasant aroma, golden yellow color, and exceptionally sweet taste. It is a leading variety grown in Tripura and has earned GI recognition for its quality and distinctive flavor.

name: Allahabad Surkha Guava
description: Allahabad Surkha Guava is a famous guava variety from Allahabad, Uttar Pradesh, known for its reddish pulp, sweet aroma, and excellent taste.

name: Basmati Rice
description: Basmati Rice from Uttar Pradesh is known worldwide for its fragrant aroma, long grains, and excellent cooking qualities.

name: Kalanamak Rice
description: Kalanamak Rice is a fine-grain scented rice variety from eastern Uttar Pradesh, known for its aroma and medicinal qualities.

name: Mango Malihabadi Dusseheri
description: Malihabadi Dusseheri Mango is a premium mango variety from Malihabad, Uttar Pradesh, celebrated for its sweet taste and rich aroma.

name: Basmati Rice
description: Basmati Rice from Uttarakhand is known for its distinctive aroma, long slender grains, and excellent cooking qualities.

name: Uttarakhand Tejpat
description: Uttarakhand Tejpat (Indian Bay Leaf) is a fragrant spice native to the region, prized for its aromatic flavor used in culinary dishes and traditional medicine.

name: Gobindobhog Rice
description: Gobindobhog Rice is a traditional aromatic short-grain rice variety from West Bengal, known for its unique fragrance and taste.

name: Malda Fazli Mango
description: Malda Fazli Mango is a large, juicy mango variety famous for its sweet taste and unique flavor from Malda district, West Bengal.

name: Malda Khirsapati (Himsagar) Mango
description: Malda Khirsapati (Himsagar) Mango is a sweet, fiberless mango variety from Malda, known for its delicious taste and aroma.

name: Malda Laxman Bhog Mango
description: Malda Laxman Bhog Mango is a premium mango variety known for its sweet taste and rich flavor, cultivated in Malda district.

name: Tulapanji Rice
description: Tulapanji Rice is a traditional aromatic rice variety from West Bengal, prized for its fragrance and unique taste.

name: Allagadda Stone Carving
description: Allagadda Stone Carving is a traditional stone carving craft from Andhra Pradesh known for intricate designs and fine artistry.

name: Andhra Pradesh Leather Puppetry
description: Andhra Pradesh Leather Puppetry is a traditional folk art involving colorful leather puppets used in storytelling.

name: Bobbili Veena
description: Bobbili Veena is a classical string musical instrument handcrafted in Andhra Pradesh with fine wood and traditional design.

name: Budithi Bell & Brass Metal Craft
description: Budithi Bell & Brass Metal Craft is a traditional metal art from Andhra Pradesh involving hand-crafted brass bells and decorative items.

name: Dharmavaram Handloom Pattu Sarees And Paavadas
description: Dharmavaram Handloom Pattu Sarees And Paavadas are exquisite silk sarees and traditional skirts known for rich colors and zari work from Andhra Pradesh.

name: Durgi Stone Carvings
description: Durgi Stone Carvings are finely crafted stone sculptures and art pieces from Andhra Pradesh, known for detailed work.

name: Etikoppaka Toys
description: Etikoppaka Toys are traditional wooden toys handcrafted and lacquered from Andhra Pradesh, showcasing vibrant colors and eco-friendly materials.

name: Kondapalli Bommallu
description: Kondapalli Bommallu are traditional wooden toys from Andhra Pradesh, handcrafted and painted with natural dyes.

name: Machilipatnam Kalamkari
description: Machilipatnam Kalamkari is a traditional hand-painted textile craft from Andhra Pradesh known for natural dyes and intricate designs.

name: Mangalagiri Sarees and Fabrics
description: Mangalagiri Sarees and Fabrics are traditional handwoven textiles from Andhra Pradesh known for their fine cotton and vibrant colors.

name: Srikalahasthi Kalamkari
description: Srikalahasthi Kalamkari is a traditional hand-painted textile art from Andhra Pradesh using natural dyes and intricate designs.

name: Udayagiri Wooden Cutlery
description: Udayagiri Wooden Cutlery is handcrafted wooden utensils from Andhra Pradesh, known for their quality and traditional craftsmanship.

name: Uppada Jamdani Sarees
description: Uppada Jamdani Sarees are exquisite handwoven sarees from Andhra Pradesh, known for their intricate designs and lightweight fabric.

name: Venkatagiri Sarees
description: Venkatagiri Sarees are fine handwoven sarees from Andhra Pradesh, known for their simplicity and elegance.

name: Idu Mishmi Textiles
description: Idu Mishmi Textiles are traditional handwoven fabrics crafted by the Idu Mishmi tribe of Arunachal Pradesh, known for their unique patterns and cultural significance.

name: Muga Silk of Assam
description: Muga Silk of Assam is a luxurious, naturally golden silk renowned for its durability and glossy texture, handwoven traditionally in Assam.

name: Madhubani Paintings
description: Madhubani Paintings are traditional folk art from Bihar, characterized by intricate patterns and vibrant colors created using natural dyes.

name: Applique (Khatwa) Work of Bihar
description: Applique (Khatwa) Work of Bihar is a traditional embroidery craft involving decorative stitching and fabric overlays.

name: Bhagalpur Silk
description: Bhagalpur Silk is a famous handwoven silk fabric from Bihar, known for its rich texture and durability.

name: Sikki Grass Products of Bihar
description: Sikki Grass Products of Bihar are handcrafted items made from sikki grass, showcasing traditional weaving techniques.

name: Sujini Embroidery Work of Bihar
description: Sujini Embroidery Work of Bihar is a traditional form of embroidery featuring intricate stitching and patterns on fabric.

name: Bastar Dhokra

description: Chunar Balua Patthar is a distinctive type of sandstone quarried from the Chunar region of Uttar Pradesh, used extensively in historic monuments and construction.

description: Bandar Laddu is a traditional sweet from Telangana made using jaggery, sesame seeds, and other local ingredients, known for its unique taste and cultural significance.

name: Dharwad Pedha
description: Dharwad Pedha is a famous sweet from Karnataka made with milk, sugar, and traditional flavorings, known for its soft texture and rich taste.

description: Jhabua Kadaknath is a unique breed of black chicken from Madhya Pradesh known for its tender, flavorful meat and high nutritional value.

name: Ratlami Sev
description: Ratlami Sev is a popular crispy snack from Madhya Pradesh made from gram flour and spices, famous for its distinct flavor and crunch.

name: Odisha Rasagola
description: Odisha Rasagola is a soft, spongy sweet made from chhena (cottage cheese) and soaked in sugar syrup, famous for its unique taste and texture originating from Odisha.

name: Kovilpatti Kadalai Mittai
description: Kovilpatti Kadalai Mittai is a traditional peanut brittle sweet known for its crunchy texture and caramelized sugar coating, originating from Kovilpatti in Tamil Nadu.

name: Palani Panchamirtham
description: Palani Panchamirtham is a sacred sweet offering made with five ingredients  jaggery, banana, ghee, honey, and cardamom  from Palani, Tamil Nadu, known for its rich taste and religious significance.

name: Srivilliputtur Palkova
description: Srivilliputtur Palkova is a rich and creamy milk fudge sweet made traditionally in Srivilliputtur, Tamil Nadu, known for its unique preparation and distinct flavor.

name: Bikaneri Bhujia
description: Bikaneri Bhujia is a popular crispy snack made from moth beans and besan (gram flour), spiced with traditional Rajasthani flavors. Originating from Bikaner, it is known for its unique taste and texture.

name: Hyderabad Haleem
description: Hyderabad Haleem is a rich, slow-cooked meat and lentil stew that is especially popular during the month of Ramadan. Known for its creamy texture and high nutritional value, it is a culinary specialty of Hyderabad.

name: Banglar Rasogolla
description: Banglar Rasogolla is a traditional Bengali sweet made from chhena (Indian cottage cheese) and semolina dough, cooked in light sugar syrup. It is soft, spongy, and widely enjoyed across India.

name: Bardhaman Mihidana
description: Bardhaman Mihidana is a fine, granular sweet made from powdered rice and ghee, originating in Bardhaman, West Bengal. It's often served with syrup or mixed with other sweets.

name: Bardhaman Sitabhog
description: Bardhaman Sitabhog is a unique Bengali sweet that looks like white rice or vermicelli and is made from chhena and rice flour, flavored with sugar and often combined with sweetened small gulab jamuns.

name: Joynagar Moa
description: Joynagar Moa is a seasonal Bengali sweet made from puffed rice (kanakchur khoi), date palm jaggery (nolen gur), and ghee. It is a winter delicacy from Joynagar, South 24 Parganas.

name: Feni
description: Feni is a traditional Goan alcoholic beverage, distilled either from cashew apple juice or coconut sap. Known for its strong aroma and distinct taste, Feni holds cultural and historical importance in Goa and is enjoyed locally and internationally.

name: Himachali Chulli Oil
description: Himachali Chulli Oil is a cold-pressed traditional oil extracted from wild apricot kernels found in the high-altitude regions of Himachal Pradesh. Known for its therapeutic properties and use in cooking, it is valued for its nutty aroma, light texture, and high vitamin content.

name: Mysore Agarbathi
description: Mysore Agarbathi is a traditional incense stick known for its unique blend of natural ingredients, including sandalwood, resins, and essential oils, handcrafted using age-old techniques in Karnataka.

name: Mysore Sandal Soap
description: Mysore Sandal Soap is a heritage product made using pure sandalwood oil. It is valued for its skin-friendly ingredients and lingering natural fragrance.

name: Mysore Sandalwood Oil
description: Mysore Sandalwood Oil is an iconic essential oil extracted from the heartwood of the Santalum album tree, revered for its fragrance, medicinal, and therapeutic properties.

name: Nashik Valley Wine
description: Nashik Valley Wine is a premium Indian wine produced in the Nashik region of Maharashtra, known for its ideal climate and terroir for viticulture. The wines from this region include red, white, ros, and sparkling varieties with rich aroma and flavor profiles.

name: Ganjam Kewda Rooh
description: Ganjam Kewda Rooh is a fragrant extract derived from the male flowers of the kewda plant, grown in the Ganjam district of Odisha. It is widely used in perfumery, food flavoring, and traditional medicine due to its rich, aromatic essence.

name: Coimbatore Wet Grinder
description: Coimbatore Wet Grinder is a GI-tagged kitchen appliance manufactured in Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu, known for its durable stone-based grinding mechanism, ideal for making batter for traditional South Indian cuisine.

name: Dindigul Locks
description: Dindigul Locks are strong, high-quality locks handmade in Dindigul, Tamil Nadu. These locks are known for their unique locking mechanisms and long-lasting durability.

name: East India Leather
description: East India Leather is a GI-tagged vegetable-tanned leather made using traditional methods in West Bengal. Known for its strength and eco-friendly processing, it is used for high-end fashion and accessories.

name: Kannauj Perfume
description: Kannauj Perfume, also known as Kannauj Attar, is a traditional Indian fragrance made using age-old distillation techniques and natural ingredients like flowers, herbs, and sandalwood.

name: Meerut Scissors
description: Meerut Scissors are hand-forged cutting tools known for their sharpness and durability. Traditionally crafted in Meerut, Uttar Pradesh, they are used in tailoring, households, and industry.

name: Mirzapur Pital Bartan
description: Mirzapur Pital Bartan refers to traditional brass utensils handcrafted in Mirzapur, Uttar Pradesh. These utensils are known for their aesthetic appeal and health benefits.
